{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3548816,"name":"Daniel McLaughlin","username":"Pieyama_Pieman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pieyama_pieman/{size}/242065_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T01:10:06.139Z","cooked":"

Hey,

Now look, I know SmartDashboard is deprecated, but, my team is using it so that’s what we’re sticking with.

However, I want to paste an array of values to SmartDashboard using the SmartDashboard.putNumberArray() method. Pasting a number (.putNumber()) works fine, but for whatever reason it’s not showing up for when I try to put an array. Does SmartDashboard secretly not have support for putting an array up? If so, what are my alternatives?

Provided code (subsystem works fine, so that’s not the issue):

public void getTPose() {

tPose = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable("limelight").getEntry("targetpose_robotspace").getDoubleArray(new double [6]);

}

SmartDashboard.putNumberArray("Target Pose Array", tPose);

Most dashboards don’t support showing number arrays. Your best bet is to use OutlineViewer or AdvantageScope.

Would there be a way for me to ascertain a value from the array to paste as a singular number?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T01:27:33.509Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":24,"readers_count":23,"score":9.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494429,"topic_slug":"smartdashboard-putnumberarray-not-working","display_username":"Daniel McLaughlin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50684,"username":"crueter","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69324,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/smartdashboard-putnumberarray-not-working/494429/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3548869,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T01:50:08.980Z","cooked":"

I’m not sure. I believe OutlineViewer can, not sure about AdvantageScope. Otherwise you’re best off indexing the array and putting that value to the dashboard i.e. tPose[2].

A shot in the dark is to try Shuffleboard or Elastic. I believe those dashboards can display double arrays as text.
